dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey, B, wild week for the markets, huh? I mean, Friday ended on a really strong note.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey, B, wild week for the markets, huh? I mean, Friday ended on a really strong note.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: U.S. stocks plunged on Friday following the news, with the S&P 500 down almost 0.7% and the Dow down nearly 250 points, or 0.8%, in morning trading.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, totally, A! But the *why* is, like, pretty unexpected. You hear about the stock rally, and then you dig in...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, totally, A! But the why is, like, pretty unexpected. You hear about the stock rally, and then you dig in...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I know! Global stocks soared, setting new records, and it was all, um, apparently because a U.S. airstrike *didn't* kill any key Iranian figures.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I know! Global stocks soared, setting new records, and it was all, um, apparently because a U S airstrike didn't kill any key Iranian figures.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Global stock markets pulled back from their strong start to the new year and oil prices surged on Friday, following an overnight U.S. airstrike that killed Irans most senior general and significantly inflamed tensions in the Middle East.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right? Major General Soleimani, who everyone thought was targeted, was unharmed. And then, like, Iran immediately started de-escalating tensions. It's, uh, the opposite of the knee-jerk reaction you'd expect.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? Major General Soleimani, who everyone thought was targeted, was unharmed. And then, like, Iran immediately started de-escalating tensions. It's, uh, the opposite of the knee-jerk reaction you'd expect.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Major General Qassem Soleimani, one of Irans top military leaders, was killed in a drone strike at Baghdad International Airport on Thursday night, the Pentagon confirmed, sparking strong condemnations from the Iranian governmentwho vowed to retaliate for the action.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And that unexpected geopolitical calm, it just sent the S&P 500 and the Dow soaring. Up almost 0.7%, 0.8% respectively.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And that unexpected geopolitical calm, it just sent the S and P five hundred and the Dow soaring. Up almost zero point seven percent, zero point eight percent respectively.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: U.S. stocks plunged on Friday following the news, with the S&P 500 down almost 0.7% and the Dow down nearly 250 points, or 0.8%, in morning trading.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But then the really wild part for me was oil prices. Everyone predicted they'd, like, jump, right? But they totally fell!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then the really wild part for me was oil prices. Everyone predicted they'd, like, jump, right? But they totally fell!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While stocks retreated from their early 2020 rally, oil prices surged more than 4%, hitting an 8-month high of almost $70 per barrel.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know! Down over 4%, hitting an 8-month low. Even major energy companies saw their shares drop, which, um, makes sense given the oil plunge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know! Down over four percent, hitting an eight-month low. Even major energy companies saw their shares drop, which, um, makes sense given the oil plunge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: U.S. stocks retreated from the fresh record highs that they hit on Thursday, although shares of major energy companies rose in early trading alongside the surge in oil prices.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, this "failed" strike actually led to, like, stability, which is great for markets. Adam Crisafulli, you know, from Vital Knowledge, called it the "least consequential decision" made by Trump so far.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, this failed strike actually led to, like, stability, which is great for markets. Adam Crisafulli, you know, from Vital Knowledge, called it the least consequential decision made by Trump so far.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Striking Soleimani is the most consequential decision made by Trump thus far, while the S&P 500s high valuation multiple doesnt leave it with much capacity to absorb bad news.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Which is fascinating, considering this whole thing kicked off after that New Year's Eve attack on the U.S. embassy in Baghdad.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is fascinating, considering this whole thing kicked off after that New Year's Eve attack on the U S embassy in Baghdad.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This latest action by the Pentagon comes as a response to a New Years Eve attack by Iran-backed militias on the U.S. embassy in Baghdad.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And get this, A: Iran's Foreign Minister, on Twitter, called the U.S. action "very safe and sensible." They're, uh, applauding us.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And get this, A: Iran's Foreign Minister, on Twitter, called the U S action very safe and sensible. They're, uh, applauding us.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Iranian Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif said on Twitter that the U.S. bears responsibility for what he called an extremely dangerous and foolish escalation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's so bizarre. Analysts are actually optimistic now that this could lead to Iran cooperating more with U.S. allies, like Saudi Arabia.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's so bizarre. Analysts are actually optimistic now that this could lead to Iran cooperating more with U S allies, like Saudi Arabia.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Analysts are concerned that the U.S. airstrikes will lead Iran to retaliate by attacking oil infrastructure of U.S. allies in the Middle East, like Saudi Arabia, according to CNBC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which, if that happens, would, um, stabilize global oil supply chains and probably send oil prices even lower.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, if that happens, would, um, stabilize global oil supply chains and probably send oil prices even lower.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Such a retaliation would disrupt global oil supply chains and likely also send the prices oil skyrocketing further.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, good news, basically, out of something that initially sounded like it would be, you know, a major destabilizing event.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, good news, basically, out of something that initially sounded like it would be, you know, a major destabilizing event.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, a very, very unexpected start to 2020 for geopolitics and the markets, for sure.
